snippet: Child care costs have nearly doubled since the mid-1980s, but the portion of families paying for care has dropped, according to a new Census Bureau report.
abstract: Census Bureau report says child care costs have nearly doubled since the mid-1980s, but the portion of families paying for care has dropped, as many likely seek out more affordable choices.
lead_paragraph: Child care costs have nearly doubled since the mid-1980s, but the portion of families paying for care has dropped, according to a new Census Bureau report.

headline.seo: Child Care Costs Are Up, Census Finds
headline.main: As Child Care Costs Rise, Families Seek Alternatives
headline.print_headline: As Child Care Costs Rise, Families Seek Alternatives
